sections.name: Unshadowed Haibram
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Medium
traits.text: *Space:* 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 5 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Dwarf
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the dwarf ancestry. Dwarves are stout folk who often live underground and typically have darkvision. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by dwarves. An item with this trait is created and used by dwarves.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

link.name: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24
link.alt: Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients pg. 24

automatic_abilities.name: Shadow's Displeasure
automatic_abilities.text: When Haibram has fewer than 150 Hit Points, his shadow pulls at his essence to show the *Vesicant Egg's* displeasure. He looks pained and confused, and he becomes clumsy 1 and stupefied 1 until healed to 150 Hit Points or more. These conditions increase to 2 when below 100 Hit Points. When below 50 Hit Points, he falls unconscious.

automatic_abilities.name: Vesicated Shadow
automatic_abilities.text: Haibram's shadow has become corrupted via the power of the *Vesicant Egg*. His shredded shadow grants him some control over acid and shadows. He gains a +4 status bonus to resist acid and shadow effects.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon's normal damage dice doesn't change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon's normal damage dice doesn't change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack, and it is a ranged weapon when thrown. A thrown weapon adds your Strength modifier to damage just like a melee weapon does. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment specified in the weapon’s Range entry.

ability.name: Rupture Shadow

traits.name: Acid
traits.text: Effects with this trait deal acid damage. Creatures with this trait have a magical connection to acid.

traits.name: Conjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the conjuration school of magic, typically involving summoning, creation, teleportation, or moving things from place to place.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text: This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Shadow
traits.text: Magic with this trait involves shadows or the energy of the Shadow Plane. Creatures with this trait are natives of the Shadow Plane. They can survive the basic environmental effects of the Shadow Plane.

ability.critical_success: The target is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.
ability.success: The target takes half damage. The bursting shadow deals 5 acid splash damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the target.
ability.failure: The target takes full damage, and the bursting shadow deals 10 acid splash damage.
ability.critical_failure: The target takes double damage, the bursting shadow deals 20 acid splash damage, and the target also takes 4d6 persistent acid damage.
ability.text: Haibram can create immense blisters on a creature's shadow, which immediately burst, dealing 20d6 acid damage. He targets a creature within 60 feet that is casting a shadow, which must attempt a DC 37 Will save. Haibram can't use Rupture Shadow again for 1d4 rounds.

ability.name: Wind Step

traits.name: Air
traits.text: Effects with the air trait either manipulate or conjure air. Those that manipulate air have no effect in a vacuum or an area without air. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of air or have a magical connection to that element. Planes with this trait consist mostly of open spaces and air with various degrees of turbulence, though they also contain rare islands of floating stone and other elements and energies.

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Transmutation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the transmutation school of magic, typically changing something’s form.

ability.text: Haibram draws air around him to aid his movement. He Strides up to his Speed, gaining the effects of *air walk* and ignoring difficult terrain while moving. He can increase the number of actions to 3 to Stride up to three times his Speed instead. Haibram begins to fall immediately after using Wind Step but treats the fall as 60 feet shorter thanks to the supporting winds.

ability.name: Wind Touch

traits.name: Air
traits.text: Effects with the air trait either manipulate or conjure air. Those that manipulate air have no effect in a vacuum or an area without air. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of air or have a magical connection to that element. Planes with this trait consist mostly of open spaces and air with various degrees of turbulence, though they also contain rare islands of floating stone and other elements and energies.

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

ability.text: Haibram imbues a weapon he's holding with the power of the wind until the start of his next turn. The wind's power allows Haibram to swing and hurl the weapon with great force, causing the weapon to deal an additional 2d10 damage. If the weapon does not have the thrown trait, it also gains the thrown 10 feet trait during this attack.
